pages.text: Cidaroids are the scientific grouping for Sea Urchins which have had a fossils record from the Triassic. They were actually echinoderms, related to starfish and crinoids, but were like a ball of spikes. They had little tentacles on the bottom to help them walk along the seafloor, albeit very slowly. Some species of sea urchins are also venomous.
